result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard Alan Janusz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
PAY fine in the amount of $1,800.00.  The Court ordered that the fine be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges. Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge. The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
Consecutive to:  consecutive to any other sentence defendant is currently serving. Credit given for 138 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.

Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered the defendant's driver operating privileges REVOKED for a period of 2 years.
Defendant is not to operate any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.
Any vehicle titled in the defendant's name or driven by the defendant is to have an ignition interlock device installed for a period of 2 years.

records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (26 pages) CHANGE OF PLEA/SENTENCING commencing JUNE 18, 2015 received and filed.

Defendant Richard Alan Janusz in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Richard Alan Janusz in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:    The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 4 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS.
Credit given for 138 days time served.

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNT 1):
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY fine in the amount of $1,800.00.  The Court ordered that the fine be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court ordered the defendant's driver operating privileges REVOKED for a period of 2 years.
* Defendant is not to operate any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.
* Any vehicle titled in the defendant's name or driven by the defendant is to have an ignition interlock device installed for a period of 2 years.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment.
Defendant's Blood Alcohol Test Results.

Defendant Richard Alan Janusz in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Richard Alan Janusz in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum was previously filed.
and Addendum filed by Atty. Mary Guimont on behalf of the defendant.

Defendant Richard Alan Janusz NOT in court; in custody.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont appeared on behalf of the defendant.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case adjourned to 06-18-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Richard Alan Janusz not in court, in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a Projected Plea Hearing date.
Case adjourned to 05-08-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Projected Plea Hearing.

Defendant Richard Alan Janusz in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Richard Alan Janusz in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
FILED, ASSOCIATES IN PSYCHIATRY AND THE LAW FORENSIC AND GENERAL PSYCHIATRY REPORT (dated February 1, 2015)fp

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by SCRAM, drug tests and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Richard Alan Janusz in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Richard Alan Janusz in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
